api.title: API
api.enterprise-required-description: API access is available only with the Enterprise plan. Upgrade your plan to access this feature.
api.key-name-description: A descriptive name to identify your API key
api.api-key-copy-warning: Copy this key now. It will never be shown again for security reasons.
api.regenerate-confirm: Are you sure you want to regenerate this API key? The old key will be immediately revoked.
api.revoke-confirm: Are you sure you want to revoke this API key? This action is irreversible.
api.no-keys-description: Create your first API key to start using the Hoox API.
api.api-keys-description: Manage your API keys for programmatic access to Hoox.
api.documentation-card-description: Learn how to integrate Hoox into your applications with our comprehensive API documentation.

tooltip.title: Select how you want your file to be used:
tooltip.voice: The file will become your video's voice, so no script generation or voice selection.
tooltip.avatar: If the video contains a speaking person, we'll add editing around it, so no script generation, voice selection, or avatar choice.
tooltip.media: The file will be automatically added to your video at the right moment.

ai-get-all-start-generation.0: You sent me an avatar file, I'll use it as both avatar and voice. I don't need more information, so I've started the generation. You can see the generation progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.1: I've received your avatar and I'm using it for the voice as well. The generation is underway, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.2: With your avatar file, I'm managing the voice and appearance. The generation has started, check the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.3: Your avatar will also be used for the voice. I've started the generation, here's where we are:
ai-get-all-start-generation.4: I'm using your file for both the avatar and the voice. The generation is launched, follow the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.5: Avatar and voice configured with your file. Generation in progress, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.6: Your file covers both the avatar and the voice. I've started the generation, check the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.7: I'm processing your avatar for image and sound. The generation is launched, here's the status:
ai-get-all-start-generation.8: With your file, I have the avatar and the voice. Generation in progress, observe the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.9: I'm using your avatar for both image and voice. The generation is progressing, here's the follow-up:
ai-get-all-start-generation.10: Your file handles both avatar and voice. I've launched the generation, check the evolution:
ai-get-all-start-generation.11: Avatar and voice configured from your file. The generation is in progress, here's the state:
ai-get-all-start-generation.12: I'm using your avatar for both aspects. Generation launched, follow the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.13: Your file acts as both avatar and voice. The generation is progressing, here's the status:
ai-get-all-start-generation.14: I'm processing your file for avatar and sound. Generation in progress, observe the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.15: Avatar and voice extracted from your file. I've launched the generation, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.16: Your file covers both needs. The generation is in progress, check the evolution:
ai-get-all-start-generation.17: I'm using your avatar for everything. Generation started, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.18: The file handles both avatar and voice. Creation is launched, follow the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.19: Avatar and sound configured with your file. Generation in progress, here's the status:
ai-get-all-start-generation.20: I'm utilizing your file for everything. The generation progresses, observe the evolution:
ai-get-all-start-generation.21: Your avatar will serve both aspects. Generation launched, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.22: I'm processing your file for everything. Creation is in progress, check the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.23: Avatar and voice from your file. Generation started, follow the evolution:
ai-get-all-start-generation.24: I'm using your file to manage everything. The generation progresses, here's the status:
ai-get-all-start-generation.25: Your avatar covers both needs. Generation in progress, observe the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.26: I'm configuring everything from your file. The creation progresses, here's the progress:
ai-get-all-start-generation.27: Avatar and voice drawn from your file. Generation launched, check the evolution:
ai-get-all-start-generation.28: I'm using your avatar for everything. The creation progresses, here's the follow-up:
ai-get-all-start-generation.29: Your file manages everything. Generation in progress, observe the progress:

ai-get-audio-select-avatar.0: I've received your audio file, I'll use it for the video. You can now choose an avatar, but it's not mandatory. Move to the next step if you wish.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.1: Your audio file is ready for the video. Choose an avatar if you want, but you can also move directly to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.2: Audio received and ready to be used for the video. Select an avatar if necessary, otherwise move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.3: I'll use your audio file for the video. You can select an avatar, or simply move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.4: Your audio is in place for the video. Choose an avatar if you wish, otherwise continue without.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.5: Audio well received for the video. You can opt for an avatar or move to the next without choosing.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.6: I have your audio file for the video. Choosing an avatar is optional, move on if you don't need one.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.7: Your audio file will be used for the video. It's up to you to decide if you want an avatar or move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.8: Audio ready for the video. Avatar selection possible, but you can also move on.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.9: I have the audio for the video. Choose an avatar if you want, otherwise move directly.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.10: Your audio is ready for the video. The avatar is optional, you can go to the next step if you wish.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.11: I've received the audio for the video. Select an avatar or move to the next step as you choose.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.12: Your audio file is ready to use. Choosing an avatar is optional, continue if you don't need one.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.13: Audio in place for the video. Avatar choice possible, but not necessary to move on.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.14: I'll use the audio for the video. You can decide to choose an avatar or not.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.15: Audio received for the video. Select an avatar if you want, or move on without.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.16: Your audio file is ready. You can choose an avatar or move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.17: I have your audio for the video. Choosing an avatar is an option, you can move on without.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.18: Audio ready for the video. The avatar is optional, move on if you wish.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.19: I have the audio, ready for the video. Choose an avatar if necessary, or continue without.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.20: Your audio is in place. The avatar is optional, move to the next step if desired.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.21: Audio well received. You have the option to choose an avatar or move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.22: I'll use the audio file for the video. The avatar is optional, move on if you don't want one.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.23: Your audio file is ready. Avatar choice possible, but not mandatory.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.24: Audio ready for use. You can select an avatar or move to the next step.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.25: I've received your audio. Choosing an avatar is optional, continue if you don't need one.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.26: Your audio will be used for the video. Select an avatar if desired, otherwise continue.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.27: Audio in place for the video. The avatar is optional, move to the next step if you want.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.28: I have the audio ready. Choosing an avatar is an option, you can move on without.
ai-get-audio-select-avatar.29: Audio received for the video. Avatar choice possible, but you can move to the next step.

ai-select-avatar.0: Perfect! You can now choose an avatar for your video, but it's not mandatory. Move to the next step if you prefer.
ai-select-avatar.1: Now, choose an avatar to represent your video. It's not mandatory, you can go to the next step if you want.
ai-select-avatar.2: Great! You have the option to select an avatar for your video. It's not necessary, move on if you wish.
ai-select-avatar.3: Choose an avatar for your video if you wish. Otherwise, move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.4: You can opt for an avatar for your video. It's not mandatory, continue without if you prefer.
ai-select-avatar.5: Perfect! Select an avatar if needed for your video, or move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.6: Choosing an avatar for your video is possible. It's not mandatory, you can move on.
ai-select-avatar.7: Now, you have the option to take an avatar for the video. Move to the next step if you don't need one.
ai-select-avatar.8: Perfect! Select an avatar for your video, or move to the next step if you want.
ai-select-avatar.9: Choosing an avatar is an option for your video, continue if you prefer not to have one.
ai-select-avatar.10: You can choose an avatar to embody your video, but it's optional. Move to the next step if you wish.
ai-select-avatar.11: Now, select an avatar for your video, or move directly to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.12: Perfect! Take an avatar for your video if you want, or continue without.
ai-select-avatar.13: Choosing an avatar is possible. It's not mandatory, move to the next step if you want.
ai-select-avatar.14: Select an avatar for your video if you wish, or move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.15: You can choose an avatar for your video, but it's not necessary. Move to the next step if you want.
ai-select-avatar.16: Perfect! Choose an avatar to represent your video, or move on without.
ai-select-avatar.17: Now, you can opt for an avatar for your video. It's not mandatory.
ai-select-avatar.18: Select an avatar for your video, or move to the next step if you don't need one.
ai-select-avatar.19: Choosing an avatar is an option. Move to the next step if you prefer.
ai-select-avatar.20: Perfect! You can take an avatar for your video, or move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.21: Now, choose an avatar if you want for your video, otherwise continue.
ai-select-avatar.22: You can select an avatar for your video, or simply move on.
ai-select-avatar.23: Perfect! Select an avatar if desired, or move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.24: Choose an avatar for your video if necessary, otherwise continue.
ai-select-avatar.25: Now, you can opt for an avatar for your video, or move to the next step.
ai-select-avatar.26: Perfect! Take an avatar for your video, or move on if you wish.
ai-select-avatar.27: Selecting an avatar is optional. Move to the next step if you want.
ai-select-avatar.28: Choose an avatar for your video, or continue without if you prefer.
ai-select-avatar.29: Perfect! You can choose an avatar for your video, but move on if you don't need one.

section1.title: 1. Identification of HOOX
section1.content:
**HOOX** company ("HOOX") is a simplified joint-stock company registered in the RCS of CrÃ©teil under nÂ°940148216, whose registered office is at 14 avenue du GÃ©nÃ©ral de Gaulle 94160 SAINT-MANDE.

HOOX can be contacted at the following coordinates:
- email address: contact@hoox.video
- phone number: 06 70 44 94 05

section2.title: 2. Services offered
section2.content: HOOX offers its clients (the "Clients") a video creation service (the "Services") through the HOOX platform accessible on the website www.hoox.video (the "Platform").

section3.title: 3. Information about the Terms and Conditions

table.function-title: Function of the Terms and Conditions
table.function-content:
The general conditions (the "Terms and Conditions") constitute the **sole document** governing the contractual relationship of HOOX with the Client and define:
- the terms of use of its Services,
- the respective obligations of the parties.
table.location-title: Location of the Terms and Conditions
table.location-content: The Client can find them through a direct link at the bottom of the Platform page.
table.acceptance-content:
The Client accepts the "Terms and Conditions" by **checking a box** in the registration form. If they do not accept all of the "Terms and Conditions", they cannot access the Services.

They may be supplemented by special conditions, which, in case of contradiction, prevail over the "Terms and Conditions".

section4.title: 4. Conditions of access to the Services
section4.content:
The Client is:
- a natural person with full legal capacity,
- or a legal person acting through a natural person with the required power or authorization to contract on behalf of the Client and for their account.

section5.title: 5. Access and subscription procedures for the Services
section5.content:
The Client can access the Services by going directly to the **Platform**.

To subscribe to the Services, the Client must:
- fill out the form provided for this purpose on the Platform, or
- be registered on one of the third-party sites indicated on the Platform, use their login credentials from the selected third-party site. They expressly authorize HOOX to access the data from their account on the relevant third-party site.

The Client must provide HOOX with all information marked as mandatory.

Registration automatically results in the opening of an account in the Client's name (the "Account") which allows them to access the Services using their login link identifier.

subsection6_1.title: 6.1. The Services
subsection6_1.content:
Before any subscription, the Client acknowledges that they can learn about the characteristics of the Services and their constraints, particularly technical ones, on the website www.hoox.video (the "Site").

The Client acknowledges that the implementation of the Services requires being connected to the internet and that the quality of the Services depends on this connection, for which **HOOX is not responsible**.

The Services to which the Client has subscribed are described on the Platform.

The Platform offers the following features:
- Automatic generation of videos from an idea, a URL, or prompts provided by the Client (the "Videos"),
- Possibility for the Client to use audio content or use that of a personalized avatar,
- Choice of Video duration according to the proposed parameters,
- Automated editing integrating post-production elements by artificial intelligence.

For creating Videos, the Client:
- Has access to media libraries (image banks, music, etc.) offered by third-party publishers (the "Libraries"),
- can import their own multimedia files (the "Files").

The Client subscribes to the Services in the form of a subscription (the "Subscription"). Each Subscription includes a predetermined number of credits that allows the Client to use the Services on the Platform (the "Credits"). These Credits are consumed (i) when downloading the Video based on the content and duration of the Video and/or (ii) when using other features present on the Platform (such as generating a video based on an image).

**HOOX reserves the right to offer any other Service.**

Any request to modify the subscribed Services must be the subject of a new subscription.

maintenance.title: 6.2.1. Maintenance
maintenance.content:
The Client benefits during the duration of the Services from **maintenance**, particularly corrective and evolutionary. In this context, access to the Platform may be limited or suspended.

Regarding corrective maintenance, HOOX makes its best efforts to provide the Client with corrective maintenance to correct any dysfunction or bug identified on the Platform.

Regarding evolutionary maintenance, the Client benefits during the duration of the Services from evolutionary maintenance, which HOOX may perform automatically and without prior information, and which includes improvements to Platform features, the addition of new features and/or technical installations used within the Platform (aimed at introducing minor or major extensions).

Access to the Platform may also be limited or suspended for reasons of planned maintenance, which may include the aforementioned corrective and evolutionary maintenance operations.

hosting.title: 6.2.2. Hosting
hosting.content: HOOX ensures, under the terms of a **best efforts obligation**, the hosting of the Platform, as well as data produced and/or entered by/on the Platform, through a professional hosting provider.

support.title: 6.2.3. Technical support
support.content:
In case of difficulty encountered when using the Services, the Client can contact HOOX at the coordinates mentioned in the article "Identification of HOOX".

The technical support service is accessible **Monday to Friday**, excluding public holidays or bank holidays, from **8 am to 6 pm**. Depending on the identified need, HOOX will estimate the response time and keep the Client informed.

section7.title: 7. Duration of subscription to Services
section7.content:
The Subscription begins on the day of its subscription for an initial period of **one month or one year** depending on the offer to which they have subscribed and which will be indicated on the Platform.

It is tacitly renewed, for successive periods of the same duration as the initial period (with the initial period, the "Periods"), from date to date, unless the Subscription is terminated under the conditions of the article "End of Services".

According to article L215-1 of the Consumer Code:

"For service contracts concluded for a fixed term with a tacit renewal clause, the professional service provider informs the consumer in writing, by registered letter or dedicated electronic mail, at the earliest three months and at the latest one month before the end of the period authorizing the rejection of renewal, of the possibility of not renewing the contract they concluded with a tacit renewal clause. This information, delivered in clear and understandable terms, mentions, in a visible box, the deadline for non-renewal.

When this information has not been sent to them in accordance with the provisions of the first paragraph, the consumer may terminate the contract free of charge, at any time from the renewal date.

Advances made after the last renewal date or, for indefinite-term contracts, after the date of transformation of the initial fixed-term contract, are in this case refunded within thirty days from the termination date, minus amounts corresponding, up to that date, to the execution of the contract. The provisions of this article apply without prejudice to those that legally subject certain contracts to particular rules regarding consumer information."

subsection8_1.title: 8.1. Service Prices
subsection8_1.content:
The prices of the Services to which the Client has subscribed as well as the prices of Credit packs (the "Credit Packs") that can be purchased as a supplement are indicated on the Platform.

Unused Credits will be treated according to the following system:
- During the **first 3 months** of the Subscription: **30% of unused Credits** during the relevant month are carried over to the following month.
- From the **4th month** of the Subscription: unused Credits are neither refunded nor carried over.

Any Period started is due in its entirety.

**HOOX is free to offer promotional offers or price reductions.**

HOOX prices may be revised at any time under the conditions of the article "Modification of General Conditions".

subsection8_2.title: 8.2. HOOX billing and payment procedures
subsection8_2.content:
HOOX sends the Client an **invoice per Period** by any useful means.

Payment of the Subscription is made by automatic debit upon subscription to the Subscription, then at each renewal.

Payment of the Credit Packs is made by **credit card** through the secure online payment service specified on the HOOX Platform.

Payment is implemented through the payment service provider indicated on the Platform.

The Client guarantees to HOOX that they have the necessary authorizations to use this payment method.

subsection8_3.title: 8.3. Consequences in case of late or default payment
subsection8_3.content:
In case of default or late payment, HOOX reserves the right, from the day after the due date appearing on the invoice, to:

- immediately suspend the Services in progress until payment of all amounts due,

- For professional Clients: charge in its favor a **late payment interest equal to 3 times the legal interest rate**, based on the amount of sums not settled at maturity and a **flat-rate compensation of 40 euros** for collection costs, without prejudice to additional compensation if the collection costs actually incurred are higher than this amount.

section9.title: 9. Client's right of withdrawal
section9.content:
The Client benefits from a **right of withdrawal**:
- if they are a consumer,
- if they are (i) a professional who has **5 employees or fewer**, (ii) purchases a good or service not falling within their main field of activity (i.e. does not relate closely or remotely to the Services) and that (iii) the contract is concluded "off-premises", namely:
  - in a place, different from HOOX's premises, where HOOX and the Client were present together physically and simultaneously (for example: signing the quote at the Client's premises),
  - on the Client's premises or by means of a distance communication technique, immediately after HOOX has personally and individually solicited the Client (i) in a place different from that of HOOX's premises and (ii) where HOOX and the Client were present together physically and simultaneously (for example: meeting at the Client's premises or at a trade show, delivery of a quote on this occasion, then signing by the Client on their premises (handwritten or online subscription)).

This right of withdrawal is 14 calendar days from the acceptance of the "General Conditions". The Client can exercise this right **free of charge** by sending to HOOX before the end of the period at the coordinates mentioned in the article "Company Identification":
- the completed withdrawal form available in Annex 1,
- or any other unambiguous declaration expressing the Client's intention to withdraw.

If the Client exercises their right of withdrawal, HOOX will refund all payments received, using the same payment method that the Client used (unless they expressly accept a different method), without undue delay and at the latest **14 calendar days** from the day HOOX was informed of the Client's intention to withdraw.

If the Client requests that the Services begin before the expiration of the withdrawal period, by checking the box for this purpose in the form, they are only liable for the price of the Services calculated pro rata for the Services provided until the day HOOX was informed of the Client's intention to withdraw.

section10.title: 10. Legal guarantee of conformity
section10.content:
The consumer has the right to the implementation of the **legal guarantee of conformity** in case of appearance of a conformity defect during the duration of the contractual relationship between the parties. During this period, the consumer is only required to establish the existence of the conformity defect and not the date of its appearance.

The legal guarantee of conformity entails the obligation to provide all **necessary updates** to maintain the conformity of digital content or digital service during the duration of the contractual relationship between the parties.

The legal guarantee of conformity gives the consumer the right to bring into conformity digital content or digital service without unjustified delay following their request, without cost and without major inconvenience to them.

The consumer can obtain a **price reduction** while keeping the digital content or digital service, or they can **terminate the contract** by being fully refunded in exchange for renouncing the digital content or digital service, if:

1Â° The professional refuses to bring the digital content or digital service into conformity,
2Â° Bringing the digital content or digital service into conformity is unjustifiably delayed,
3Â° Bringing the digital content or digital service into conformity cannot occur without costs imposed on the consumer,
4Â° Bringing the digital content or digital service into conformity causes major inconvenience to the consumer,
5Â° The non-conformity of the digital content or digital service persists despite the professional's unsuccessful attempt to bring it into conformity.

The consumer also has the right to a **price reduction** or **contract resolution** when the conformity defect is so serious that it justifies immediate price reduction or contract resolution. The consumer is then not required to request conformity of the digital content or digital service beforehand.

In cases where the conformity defect is minor, the consumer only has the right to contract cancellation if the contract does not provide for payment of a price.

Any period of unavailability of digital content or digital service for the purpose of bringing it back into conformity suspends the guarantee that remained to run until the provision of digital content or digital service that is again compliant.

These rights result from the application of articles L. 224-25-1 to L. 224-25-31 of the Consumer Code.

The professional who maliciously obstructs the implementation of the legal guarantee of conformity incurs a **civil fine of a maximum amount of 300,000 euros**, which can be increased to 10% of average annual turnover (article L. 242-18-1 of the Consumer Code).

The consumer also benefits from the **legal guarantee of hidden defects** under articles 1641 to 1649 of the Civil Code, for a period of **two years** from the discovery of the defect. This guarantee gives the right to a price reduction if the digital content or digital service is kept, or to a full refund in exchange for renouncing the digital content or digital service.

subsection11_1.title: 11.1. Intellectual property rights on the Platform
subsection11_1.content:
The **Platform** is the property of HOOX, as well as the software, infrastructure, databases and content of all kinds (texts, images, visuals, music, logos, trademarks, etc.) that it operates.

They are protected by all intellectual property rights or database producer rights in force. The license that HOOX grants to the Client does not result in any transfer of ownership.

The Client benefits from a **SaaS mode license** that is non-exclusive, personal and non-transferable for use of the Platform for the duration provided in the article "Duration of subscription to Services".

subsection11_2.title: 11.2. Intellectual property rights on Videos
subsection11_2.content:
Subject to the Client's compliance with the usage conditions described below applicable to (i) "Libraries" and (ii) "Client Content", HOOX grants the Client a **non-exclusive, personal and non-transferable license** on "Videos". HOOX cannot grant the Client an exclusive license due to the use of artificial intelligence. HOOX cannot guarantee that another HOOX client will not provide a similar or identical script and will not choose the same content as the Client, thus generating a video similar or identical to the one that is the subject of this license.

The license is granted for the entire legal duration of copyright protection and for the **entire world** under the conditions and restrictions ("Restrictions") listed below and subject to the usage conditions of "Libraries" whose content may be integrated by the Client into the "Videos". Subject to the "Restrictions", the license includes:

a) the right to reproduce and fix the Video on any medium and by any material or immaterial process;
b) the right to distribute, broadcast and market the Video or broadcast it free or for a fee;
c) the right to represent and publicly display the Video, free or for a fee, in any physical or immaterial location, by any media, network and authorized means of distribution;
d) the right to make modifications to the Video including cropping, adding music, text and subtitles, changing video format or adding the Client's name, brand and logo.

The **Restrictions** of the license are as follows:
- The Client and users cannot use the Video for any activity, use or content that:
  - constitutes, encourages or provides instructions to commit a criminal offense or dangerous activities that could result in serious injury, death or self-harm,
  - spreads harmful false information, such as false information inciting hatred or prejudice, or that misleads or unduly influences products, regulations, elections or other civic processes,
  - constitutes or is a threat of any kind, intimidates or harasses others, including publication of any content intended to mock, humiliate, embarrass, intimidate or affect a person,
  - is obscene, pornographic or promotes sexually explicit or implicit content (for example by linking to adult or pornographic websites),
  - hateful or offensive,
  - contains or encourages violence or discrimination based on race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, serious illness, disability or age,
  - promotes or enables prohibited activities,
  - violates advertising platform rules,
  - violates regulations applicable to commercial influence or requires addition of mandatory information (for example, sponsored content).

- The Client and users cannot use the Video to (i) create a competing business to HOOX and (ii) engage in misleading or false advertising.

In case of non-compliance with the conditions and/or "Restrictions" of the license:
- the Client is **responsible for any damage** caused to HOOX and/or third parties in relation to this non-compliance.
- HOOX may ask the Client to remove any Video from all media where it is used in case of a removal request made by the third party whose rights have been harmed. The Client then undertakes to remove the "Videos" within the timeframes requested by HOOX.

Notwithstanding the above, the Client acknowledges and accepts that due to the sensitive nature of **image rights**, HOOX may ask the Client to remove all "Videos" from all media where they are used, in case of a removal request made by the third party whose rights have been harmed. The Client then undertakes to remove the "Videos" within the timeframes requested by HOOX.

Except for "Client Content", as defined below, for which the Client is solely responsible, **HOOX guarantees to the Client that it holds all necessary rights** for granting the license. It guarantees that the "Video" does not constitute an infringement of third-party rights, whatever they may be.

subsection11_3.title: 11.3. Intellectual property rights on Client Files and content
subsection11_3.content:
The script, "Files" and any element provided by the Client to be integrated into the Video (collectively "Client Content") remain the property of the Client and may be protected by all industrial and intellectual property rights.

In order to implement the Services described in the article "Description of Services", generate "Videos" and improve the Services, the Client grants HOOX, **free of charge**, a worldwide license to use the integrated "Client Content" elements, which includes:
- The right to reproduce and fix the integrated elements.
- The right to represent the integrated elements.
- The right to adapt, translate, modify, arrange, transform and correct the integrated elements.
- The right to use Client Content with third-party services, particularly for content analysis used in the Services.
- The right to train HOOX's artificial intelligence models for the purpose of improving the Services.
- The right to promote the Services and HOOX's activity.

The Client is prohibited from using and guarantees not to use "Client Content" that:
- violates public order and good morals (pornographic, obscene, indecent, shocking or inappropriate for family audiences, defamatory, insulting, violent, racist, xenophobic or revisionist),
- violates third-party rights (counterfeit content, violation of personality rights, etc.),
- is harmful to third parties in any way,
- is false, misleading or promotes illegal, fraudulent or deceptive activities,
- is harmful to third-party computer systems.

The Client **guarantees HOOX against any violation of third-party rights**, and particularly against any claim, action, procedure or demand made by a third party against HOOX due to a violation of intellectual property rights, contracts, personality rights, or any other legal or regulatory violation.

The Client acknowledges and accepts that it is their responsibility to collect image use authorizations (and where applicable name and/or voice) of any natural person whose personality attributes are captured in the "Client Content" integrated by the Client into the "Videos".

The Client is **solely responsible** for obtaining authorizations for personality rights of people appearing in the Client's Video for the uses they wish to make as well as for uses made by HOOX as indicated above.

subsection11_4.title: 11.4. Intellectual property rights on Libraries
subsection11_4.content:
These "General Conditions" do not affect the intellectual property rights of third-party publishers who own the "Libraries", who retain intellectual property.

Thus, the Client and users benefit from a **license to use the "Libraries"**, for the duration provided in the article "Duration of subscription to Services" and under the conditions provided within the terms of use of the "Libraries" owners, listed at the following address: https://www.pexels.com/fr-FR/terms-of-service/.

subsection12_1.title: 12.1. Regarding information provision
subsection12_1.content: The Client undertakes to provide HOOX with all **necessary information** for subscription and use of the Services.

subsection12_2.title: 12.2. Regarding the Client's Account
subsection12_2.content:
The Client:
- guarantees that the information transmitted in the form is accurate and undertakes to update it,
- acknowledges that this information serves as proof of their identity and commits them upon validation,
- is **responsible for maintaining confidentiality** and security of their login. Any access to the Platform using these is deemed to be performed by them.

The Client must immediately contact HOOX at the coordinates mentioned in the article "HOOX Identification" if they notice that their Account has been used without their knowledge. They acknowledge that HOOX will have the right to take all appropriate measures in such cases.

subsection12_3.title: 12.3. Regarding use of Services
subsection12_3.content:
The Client is **responsible for their use of the Services** and any information they share in this context. They undertake to use the Services personally and not allow any third party to use them in their place or on their behalf.

The Client is prohibited from misusing the Services for purposes other than those for which they were designed, and particularly for:
- exercising illegal or fraudulent activity,
- harming public order and good morals,
- harming third parties or their rights, in any way,
- violating contractual, legislative or regulatory provisions,
- exercising any activity likely to interfere with a third party's computer system, particularly to violate its integrity or security,
- performing maneuvers aimed at promoting their services and/or sites or those of a third party,
- helping or inciting a third party to commit one or more acts or activities listed above.

The Client is also prohibited from:
- copying, modifying or misappropriating any element belonging to HOOX or any concept it operates within the Services,
- adopting any behavior likely to interfere with or misappropriate HOOX's computer systems or harm its computer security measures,
- harming HOOX's financial, commercial or moral rights and interests,
- marketing, transferring or providing access in any way to the Services, information hosted on the Platform or any element belonging to HOOX.

The Client is **responsible for "Client Content"** of any nature that they distribute within the Services. In particular, the Client:
- Declares and guarantees that they hold the necessary rights for use and exploitation of "Client Content" or that they have the required authorizations;
- Assumes full responsibility for imported "Client Content", particularly regarding respect for copyright, image rights and any applicable regulation;
- Acknowledges that HOOX cannot be held responsible for potential violations of third-party rights resulting from use of this "Client Content".

The Client is informed that videos/responses provided within the Platform are generated by an **artificial intelligence system**. Although designed to be accurate and useful, these responses:
- are produced automatically by an advanced language model,
- may contain occasional errors or inaccuracies,
- reflect the model's knowledge up to its last update,
- may evolve or be refined over time with system improvements.

It is up to the Client and users to exercise discernment in interpreting and using this information/elements generated by the artificial intelligence system.

**HOOX does not guarantee** that "Videos" generated on the Platform correspond exactly to the Client's needs.

HOOX does not want its artificial intelligence system to be used for high-risk uses and does not want to be a high-risk artificial intelligence provider. Therefore:
- the Client is prohibited from modifying the Platform and/or using it for high-risk purposes,
- the Client is prohibited from using it as indicated as high-risk by artificial intelligence regulation and particularly, without this list being exhaustive, is prohibited from using it (i) to make decisions affecting conditions of professional relationships, promotion or dismissal, (ii) to assign tasks or (iii) to monitor and evaluate people's performance and behavior.

The Client acknowledges that artificial intelligence ("AI") systems may be subject to **bias** and may potentially affect results, recommendations or decisions generated by the artificial intelligence system.

In this regard, HOOX will not be responsible for bias introduced by "Client Content" provided by the Client and responses generated based on information from this "Client Content".

HOOX implements its best efforts to correct bias inherent in the design of the artificial intelligence system on which the Platform's operation is based.

In this regard, HOOX undertakes to:
- Regularly perform queries to identify potential bias in the AI system.
- Implement corrective measures when significant bias is detected.

The Client **guarantees HOOX** against any claim and/or action that could be exercised against it following violation of one of the Client's obligations. The Client will compensate HOOX for damage suffered and reimburse it for all sums it might have to bear as a result.

section13.title: 13. HOOX Obligations and Responsibility
section13.intro:
HOOX undertakes to provide Services with **diligence**, being specified that it is bound by a best efforts obligation.

HOOX undertakes to comply with applicable regulations.

subsection13_1.title: 13.1. Regarding service quality
subsection13_1.content:
HOOX makes its best efforts to provide the Client with **quality** Services.

To this end, it regularly performs checks to verify the operation and accessibility of its Services and may thus perform maintenance under the conditions specified in the "Maintenance" article.

However, HOOX is not responsible for temporary difficulties or impossibilities in accessing its Services that originate from:
- circumstances external to its network (and particularly partial or total failure of Client servers),
- failure of equipment, cabling, services or networks not included in its Services or not under its responsibility,
- interruption of Services by telecom operators or internet access providers,
- Client intervention particularly via poor configuration applied to Services,
- force majeure case.

HOOX is responsible for the operation of its servers, whose external limits are constituted by connection points.

Moreover, it does not guarantee that the Services:
- subject to constant research to improve particularly performance and progress, will be totally free from errors, defects or faults,
- being standard and not proposed according to Client's personal constraints, will specifically meet their needs and expectations.

subsection13_2.title: 13.2. Regarding Platform service level guarantee
subsection13_2.content:
**HOOX offers no service level guarantee** for the Platform.

However, HOOX makes its best efforts to maintain access to the Platform 24/7 except in case of planned maintenance under conditions defined in the "Maintenance" article or force majeure.

subsection13_3.title: 13.3. Regarding data backup on the Platform
subsection13_3.content:
HOOX makes its best efforts to backup all data produced and/or entered by/on the Platform.

Except in case of **proven faults** by HOOX, it is nevertheless not responsible for any data loss during maintenance operations.

subsection13_4.title: 13.4. Regarding data storage and security
subsection13_4.content:
HOOX provides sufficient storage capacity for Services operation.

HOOX makes its best efforts to ensure **data security** by implementing infrastructure and Platform protection measures, malicious act detection and prevention, and data recovery.

subsection13_5.title: 13.5. Regarding content publication
subsection13_5.content:
HOOX acts as a **hosting provider** for "Client Content" that the Client puts online. Consequently, it is not responsible for this "Client Content".

If HOOX receives a notification concerning illicit "Client Content", it will act promptly to remove it or make its access impossible, and it may take measures described in the "Sanctions for breach" article.

subsection13_6.title: 13.6. Regarding subcontracting and assignment
subsection13_6.content:
HOOX may use **subcontractors** in executing Services, who are subject to the same obligations as its own in their intervention. It nevertheless remains solely responsible for proper execution of Services towards the Client.

HOOX may substitute any person who will be subrogated in all its rights and obligations under its contractual relationship with the Client. Where appropriate, it will inform the Client of this substitution by any written means.

section14.title: 14. Limitation of HOOX's liability
section14.content:
HOOX's liability is limited to **proven direct damages** only that the Client suffers from using the Services.

For professional Clients, except for bodily harm, death and gross negligence, and subject to having issued a claim by registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt, within one month following occurrence of damage, HOOX's liability cannot be engaged for an amount exceeding amounts it received during the 12 months preceding the liability-generating event or duration of its Services provision if this duration is shorter.

section15.title: 15. Accepted modes of proof
section15.content:
Proof may be established by **any means**.

The Client is informed that messages exchanged via the Platform as well as data collected on the Platform and HOOX's computer equipment constitute one of the accepted modes of proof, particularly to demonstrate the reality of Services performed and calculation of their price.

section16.title: 16. Personal data processing procedures
section16.content:
The parties undertake, each for what concerns them, to comply with all legal and regulatory obligations incumbent upon them regarding **personal data protection**, particularly law 78-17 of January 6, 1978 in its latest modified version called Computer and Freedom Law and EU regulation 2016/679 of the European Parliament and Council of April 27, 2016.

To learn more about processing carried out by HOOX, the Client is invited to read HOOX's privacy policy available on the Platform.

section17.title: 17. Force majeure
section17.content:
HOOX cannot be responsible for breaches or delays in executing its contractual obligations due to a **force majeure case** occurring during its relationship with the Client, as defined in 1218 of the Civil Code.

If HOOX is prevented from executing its obligations due to force majeure, it must inform the Client by registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt request. Obligations are suspended upon receipt of the letter, and must be resumed within reasonable time upon cessation of the force majeure case.

HOOX nevertheless remains bound to execute obligations that are not affected by a force majeure case.

section18.title: 18. End of Services
section18.content:
The Subscription must be terminated at the latest (i) **2 days before** the end of the Subscription Period if the Subscription is monthly or (ii) **one month before** the end of the Subscription Period if the Subscription is annual, by:

- The Client, directly and free of charge through the functionality provided for this purpose on the Platform
- HOOX, by sending an email to the Client.

Any Period started is due in its entirety.

section19.title: 19. Sanctions for breach
section19.content:
The following constitute **essential obligations** towards the Client (the "Essential Obligations"):
- payment of price,
- not providing erroneous, incomplete information to HOOX,
- respecting usual rules of politeness and courtesy in exchanges with HOOX,
- not using Services for a third party,
- not exercising illegal, fraudulent activities or harming third parties' rights or security, breach of public order or violation of laws and regulations in force.

In case of breach of one of these "Essential Obligations", HOOX may:
- suspend or delete the Client's access to Services,
- publish on the Platform any information message that HOOX deems useful,
- warn any competent authority, cooperate with it and provide all useful information for research and repression of illegal or illicit activities,
- initiate any legal action.

These sanctions are **without prejudice** to any damages that HOOX could claim from the Client.

In case of breach of any obligation other than an "Essential Obligation", HOOX will ask the Client by any useful written means to remedy the breach within a maximum period of **15 calendar days**. Services will end at the end of this period in the absence of regularization of the breach.

The end of Services results in deletion of the Client's Account.

section20.title: 20. Modification of General Conditions
section20.content:
HOOX may modify its "General Conditions" at any time and will inform the Client by any written means (and particularly by email) 2 calendar days before the end of the current Subscription Period if the Subscription is monthly or one month before the end of the current Subscription Period if the Subscription is annual.

The modified "General Conditions" are applicable upon **renewal of the Client's Subscription**.

If the Client does not accept these modifications, they must terminate their Subscription according to the procedures provided in the article "End of Services".

If the Client uses the Services after the entry into force of its modified "General Conditions", HOOX considers that the Client has **accepted** them.

section21.title: 21. Language
section21.content: The **French language** prevails in case of contradiction or dispute over the meaning of a term or provision.

section22.title: 22. Mediation
section22.content:
In case of dispute between the Client and HOOX, the Client may resort **free of charge** to the following consumer mediator for amicable resolution:

**Consumer Mediation Center of Justice Conciliators (CM2C)**
Postal address: 14 rue Saint Jean 75017 Paris
Phone: 01 89 47 00 14
https://www.cm2c.net

If the Client is a foreign consumer but located in the European Union, they can visit the European platform for consumer law dispute resolution accessible here.

section23.title: 23. Applicable law and competent jurisdictions
section23.content:
The "General Conditions" are governed by **French law**.

For professional Clients, in case of dispute between the Client and HOOX, and failing amicable agreement within 2 months following first notification, it will be subject to exclusive jurisdiction of **Paris courts (France)**, except contrary mandatory provisions.
